snippet: With Congress deadlocked, state legislatures have begun placing restrictions on the collection of personal data.
abstract: Editorial praises state legislatures across the country for enacting laws to regulate the kinds of information that companies and law enforcement agencies can collect about individuals and how it can be done; argues that such privacy legislation is a necessity, given Congressional inaction on this issue.
lead_paragraph: With Congress deadlocked, state legislatures have begun placing restrictions on the collection of personal data.
